document.title: Health Education Standards of Learning for Virginia Public Schools

D04D338F265142BDB946A1CCFFEEB730.description:
Demonstrate ways to reduce, reuse, and recycle at home, at school, and in the
community.

BCE51C7AD4914396A603E58F8109FAE4.description: Demonstrate positive ways to communicate with family and friends.

9BAEFD0C111B43A7AC0C52AE515474BA.description:
Describe how to report bullying and how to advocate for oneself and for others who are
bullied.

BCCFE030912347A698BF324403BE45CD.description:
Demonstrate healthy ways to resolve conflict, including determining when adult help is
needed.

AF2BE746F01B4FEAB63595EC9511BBCD.description:
Design and demonstrate effective strategies for expressing and managing emotions,
which may include physical activity, talking about feelings, reading, or creative
expressions such as writing, art, music, and dance.

78A9019524BC4998BB745BA334D0C0D4.description: Practice disaster-preparedness procedures at home and at school.

89AA0AE0BFF24A4F97DE2CE442D012C1.description: Create strategies for personal safety when online.

5784B03984404D3A93063A6997A1FDA2.description:
Discuss and develop a family safety plan to prevent injuries at home and when riding in
a motor vehicle.

727AF3CAE4F34B69A831CBF3FC44C7B1.description:
Encourage others to use refusal skills to avoid alcohol, tobacco, nicotine products,
inhalants, other drugs, and unknown substances.

C815A2C9764148AF9C89BD71190CBCD7.description:
Create a health message about the proper use of prescription and nonprescription
medications.

20F3BDB4017A4B5F872087225835591F.description: Identify healthcare professionals who can help prevent and detect health concerns.

BB40F255E6B14AAFB4365029E5140DB9.description: Identify areas for improving personal health.

BC55D6F06C774669B1B6294C67867645.description: Set a goal for a positive health practice and monitor progress.

D8C5FBD642B64062959AEF25B513D876.description:
List alternatives (e.g., stickers, pencils, games) for school celebrations that are safe for
someone with a food allergy.

751157F9BDB04A8CAD3E2AFC5B0FBE2B.description:
Explore how grains are grown and the careers related to it (e.g., agriculture, farming,
food science, environmental science).

2D8F891D9A9F4AE8AC6F65587F672BB6.description: Identify healthy food and beverage choices to support digestion and body function.

7CC4EB71576B4702B9880BECBDBC18E6.description: Evaluate the role of the digestive system in providing energy for the body.

F5C336A59C5643009186E4030A2936E8.description: The student will promote health and safety at school and at home.

D8DF1CD6C3AF4F888DAA1BA470F91210.description:
Analyze how reducing, reusing, and recycling products promotes a healthier
environment.

58EF3722E005483BBAFDF55526F3FFAE.description:
Describe how to communicate directly, respectfully, and assertively with family and
friends.

33791E310F94499B8C6E6BEA781EB44F.description: Identify ways to safely stand up to bullying and how to get help.

0ADDAE9780DC40A9A750DBDA6D3839B0.description:
Describe how to make healthy decisions when dealing with conflict, including when
help from an adult is needed.

EFCF24083EFE41CF970D3977E2BA571E.description:
Describe how to make and keep a friend and behaviors that may cause the friendship to
end (e.g., being unaware of the attitudes and feelings of others, using inappropriate
language and behavior, excluding a friend from activities, breaking promises).

9DE33413C44143CD9F2BF83EBD9ECFC4.description: Explain how to identify, express, and respond to emotions in a healthy way.

57A969D0F0974B49BFD6C3565C3AFF0E.description: Demonstrate proper behavior during safety drills at school.

2C3D1CB415584E31836A1B910D0A49DF.description: Identify situations when adult assistance may be needed with online interactions.

9EB4F5A47C2A4DEABF2DD47BA308CCC2.description:
Explain the importance of following safety rules at home and when riding in a motor
vehicle.

85A167FF0AE34A77A5BFA7167CBD313F.description:
Analyze the harmful short- and long-term effects of alcohol, tobacco, nicotine products,
common household inhalants, and other drugs on body systems.

D093A298A5044740AE52897F04757FF4.description:
Explain the consequences of disregarding medical recommendations for prescription
and nonprescription medications.

B0DF97CB8F1D41D4B3879F9F6820641B.description:
Analyze the importance of prevention and early detection of communicable and
noncommunicable diseases.

38F5995EE96A452BB8D35CE49E76BE3F.description: List the benefits of goal setting for personal health.

99EC1DF9E6914B579A5FD38B972BE33D.description:
Evaluate how sleep, physical activity, screen time, and healthy food and beverage
choices affect one’s personal health.

447072973851481D800B16327038A765.description:
Explain your school's food policy as it relates to food allergens (e.g., peanut-free
classrooms, cafeteria options for children with food allergies).

87C526E2BBD94AC9BD07F0BEFF3AEA76.description:
Explain the difference between a whole grain and a refined grain and the nutritional
benefits of eating whole grains.

BD1EA53C5B53404A8C827C7267457476.description: Describe why digestion is important for body function.

E2BCEF4BA4F948D49A404720EDCB0E24.description: Describe how the body uses digested food molecules.

3515F6D895A84BDBA28C3D9569D7ABFA.description:
The student will demonstrate the ability to use essential health concepts to improve
personal health.

2A5A8658B26043F2B42459B6F1352BCD.description: Explain what happens with waste and recycled materials.

428633F10F854CB08ED1328A8C137984.description:
Explain the benefits of positive communication on relationships with family and
friends.

7A33C48F8F834E0992AC738C88298947.description: Describe what bullying is and how to identify it.

1FC6BFECB88C40C380C7F82B393FC704.description:
Define conflict and identify possible situations where conflict can occur with family
and friends.

B2328AF679EE4235873CAE9D6CD8F0AA.description: Describe the benefits of friendship and list the qualities of a good friend.

22AEAF804A36421AA63E427D6A1D5F72.description:
Describe feelings/emotions that result from experiencing change, such as the arrival of
a new family member, making new friends, going to a new school, being accepted by
peers, and losing a loved one.

5DBFBB3147A94236B74CD01E3C96F3B6.description: Identify different safety drills that are important for home and school.

537DD8E73D2546778F711CA0988A48B2.description: Explain the need for personal safety strategies when interacting with others online.

273FAB7380B84337BED8CFA471F0E717.description: Explain safety rules at home and when riding in a motor vehicle.

9C847C4ED7D24E4696155C64A7B6BD1B.description:
Identify body systems affected by the use of alcohol, tobacco, nicotine products (e.g.,
electronic smoking devices), inhalants, and other drugs.

7A734614DB84481E9D1354426082B694.description:
Describe proper and improper use of prescription (e.g., taking medication prescribed
for someone else) and nonprescription medications.

27F199F3F22448A1AE748C672A2E954A.description:
Define noncommunicable and describe the difference between communicable and
noncommunicable diseases.

5C06846E47404635957EA06B528FAA93.description: Identify the steps for goal setting to adopt positive health practices.

276B46406D4740A6848ECA930706C3BE.description:
Describe the benefits of getting enough sleep and the consequences of the use of
electronic devices (i.e., screen time) on sleep.

92AF7D70ABDD48AD8C5BE9D9E6642623.description: Identify foods that most often cause a food allergy.

DC08C83117564C24AD4598610FBAC604.description: Identify whole grain and refined grain food items.

2A8627C341D04DFCB6E9509AE11E82AA.description:
Explain the importance of water and healthy food choices for digestion and body
function.

0802D1B2638C4CDDA54BEED64305F7CF.description: Identify the major structures and functions of the digestive system.

C1720C55E23E46319982DE7D227A3610.description:
The student will explain that health habits and practices impact personal growth and
development.
